chunks.text:
### Table 1: Eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates based on median Annual Survey of Hours and Earnings (ASHE) data

These SOC 2020 occupation codes are considered to be skilled to Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) level 6 or above, and are eligible for the Skilled Worker route. This table relates to points options A-E set out in Appendix Skilled Worker.

Going rates in Table 1 are per year and based on a 37.5-hour working week. They must be pro-rated for other working patterns, based on the weekly working hours stated by the applicant’s sponsor. Options A to E refer to the points options set out in Appendix Skilled Worker.

1.   The going rates and associated reductions which apply are whichever is the higher of: 
    1.   • the rate shown by the median ASHE data for that occupation; or
    2.   • £17.13 per hour

For the avoidance of doubt, where £17.13 per hour calculates as more than 70%, 80% or 90% of the stated going rate, £17.13 will nevertheless be taken to be 70%, 80% or 90% of the going rate, as applicable.

Only the going rate column applies to Skilled Worker settlement applications; the columns setting out 70%, 80% and 90% of the going rate do not apply.

chunks.summary: This provision applies to skilled applicants under the Skilled Worker route with SOC 2020 codes at RQF level 6 or above. It mandates that going rates are based on median ASHE data or a minimum of £17.13/hour, whichever is higher, with only the full going rate relevant for settlement applications. Critical conditions include pro-rating for different working patterns and specific thresholds when calculating percentages of the going rate.

Section: Table 1: Eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates based on median Annual Survey of Hours and Earnings (ASHE) data
Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to skilled applicants under the Skilled Worker route with SOC 2020 codes at RQF level 6 or above. It mandates that going rates are based on median ASHE data or a minimum of £17.13/hour, whichever is higher, with only the full going rate relevant for settlement applications. Critical conditions include pro-rating for different working patterns and specific thresholds when calculating percentages of the going rate.

### Table 1: Eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates based on median Annual Survey of Hours and Earnings (ASHE) data

These SOC 2020 occupation codes are considered to be skilled to Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) level 6 or above, and are eligible for the Skilled Worker route. This table relates to points options A-E set out in Appendix Skilled Worker.

Going rates in Table 1 are per year and based on a 37.5-hour working week. They must be pro-rated for other working patterns, based on the weekly working hours stated by the applicant’s sponsor. Options A to E refer to the points options set out in Appendix Skilled Worker.

1.   The going rates and associated reductions which apply are whichever is the higher of: 
    1.   • the rate shown by the median ASHE data for that occupation; or
    2.   • £17.13 per hour

For the avoidance of doubt, where £17.13 per hour calculates as more than 70%, 80% or 90% of the stated going rate, £17.13 will nevertheless be taken to be 70%, 80% or 90% of the going rate, as applicable.

Only the going rate column applies to Skilled Worker settlement applications; the columns setting out 70%, 80% and 90% of the going rate do not apply.

metadata.section_title: Table 1a: Additional eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates for Skilled Worker applicants granted permission under the rules in place before 22 July 2025

chunks.text:
### Table 1a: Additional eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates for Skilled Worker applicants granted permission under the rules in place before 22 July 2025

These SOC 2020 occupation codes are considered to be skilled to Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) level 3-5, other than “6135 Care workers and home carers”, which is considered to be skilled to RQF level 2. This table relates to points options A-E set out in Appendix Skilled Worker.

Except where option D or the Temporary Shortage List in SW 6.1A applies, sponsors may **ONLY**sponsor Skilled Worker applicants in these SOC2020 occupation codes if the applicant was granted permission as a Skilled Worker under the rules in place before 22 July 2025, and they have had continuous permission as a Skilled Worker since then.

Other than skill level, the notes accompanying Table 1 also apply to this table.

Document: Immigration Rules Appendix Skilled Occupations
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Skilled Occupations
Section ID: Table 1a: Additional eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates for Skilled Worker applicants granted permission under the rules in place before 22 July 2025
Section: Table 1a: Additional eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates for Skilled Worker applicants granted permission under the rules in place before 22 July 2025
Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to Skilled Worker applicants granted permission before 22 July 2025 in specific SOC 2020 codes, requiring sponsors to sponsor only those with continuous permission since then. It details eligible occupation codes, skill levels, and associated going rates for calculating employer obligations, with certain exceptions like the Temporary Shortage List.

### Table 1a: Additional eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates for Skilled Worker applicants granted permission under the rules in place before 22 July 2025

These SOC 2020 occupation codes are considered to be skilled to Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) level 3-5, other than “6135 Care workers and home carers”, which is considered to be skilled to RQF level 2. This table relates to points options A-E set out in Appendix Skilled Worker.

Except where option D or the Temporary Shortage List in SW 6.1A applies, sponsors may **ONLY**sponsor Skilled Worker applicants in these SOC2020 occupation codes if the applicant was granted permission as a Skilled Worker under the rules in place before 22 July 2025, and they have had continuous permission as a Skilled Worker since then.

Other than skill level, the notes accompanying Table 1 also apply to this table.

metadata.section_title: Table 2: Eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates based on 25th percentile Annual Survey of Hours and Earnings (ASHE) data

chunks.text:
### Table 2: Eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates based on 25th percentile Annual Survey of Hours and Earnings (ASHE) data

These SOC 2020 occupation codes are considered to be skilled to Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) level 6 or above, and are eligible for the Skilled Worker, Global Business Mobility and Scale-up routes. This table relates to points options F-J set out in Appendix Skilled Worker.

Going rates in Table 2 are per year and based on a 37.5-hour working week. They must be pro-rated for other working patterns, based on the weekly working hours stated by the applicant’s sponsor. Options F to J refer to the points options set out in Appendix Skilled Worker.

1.   The going rates and associated reductions which apply are whichever is the higher of: 
    1.   • the rate shown by the 25th percentile ASHE data for that occupation; or
    2.   • £12.82 per hour

For the avoidance of doubt, where £12.82 per hour calculates as more than 70%, 80% or 90% of the stated going rate, £12.82 will nevertheless be taken to be 70%, 80% or 90% of the going rate, as applicable.

Only the going rate column applies to Skilled Worker settlement applications; the columns setting out 70%, 80% and 90% of the going rate do not apply.

Equivalent SOC 2010 occupation codes are included where they were previously eligible for the Skilled Worker route, for ease of matching to the relevant SOC 2020 occupation codes for applicants being sponsored to continue working in the same occupation.

chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix Skilled Occupations
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Skilled Occupations
Section ID: Table 2: Eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates based on 25th percentile Annual Survey of Hours and Earnings (ASHE) data
Section: Table 2: Eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates based on 25th percentile Annual Survey of Hours and Earnings (ASHE) data
Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to Skilled Worker applicants and sponsors for eligible SOC 2020 occupations at RQF level 6 or above. It requires employers to pay going rates based on the higher of ASHE 25th percentile data or £12.82/hour, pro-rated for working hours. Only the full going rate applies for settlement applications, with specific thresholds and exceptions detailed.

### Table 2: Eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates based on 25th percentile Annual Survey of Hours and Earnings (ASHE) data

These SOC 2020 occupation codes are considered to be skilled to Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) level 6 or above, and are eligible for the Skilled Worker, Global Business Mobility and Scale-up routes. This table relates to points options F-J set out in Appendix Skilled Worker.

Going rates in Table 2 are per year and based on a 37.5-hour working week. They must be pro-rated for other working patterns, based on the weekly working hours stated by the applicant’s sponsor. Options F to J refer to the points options set out in Appendix Skilled Worker.

1.   The going rates and associated reductions which apply are whichever is the higher of: 
    1.   • the rate shown by the 25th percentile ASHE data for that occupation; or
    2.   • £12.82 per hour

For the avoidance of doubt, where £12.82 per hour calculates as more than 70%, 80% or 90% of the stated going rate, £12.82 will nevertheless be taken to be 70%, 80% or 90% of the going rate, as applicable.

Only the going rate column applies to Skilled Worker settlement applications; the columns setting out 70%, 80% and 90% of the going rate do not apply.

Equivalent SOC 2010 occupation codes are included where they were previously eligible for the Skilled Worker route, for ease of matching to the relevant SOC 2020 occupation codes for applicants being sponsored to continue working in the same occupation.

metadata.section_title: Table 2aa: Additional eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates for Skilled Worker applicants granted permission under the rules in place before 22 July 2025

chunks.text:
### Table 2aa: Additional eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates for Skilled Worker applicants granted permission under the rules in place before 22 July 2025

These SOC 2020 occupation codes are considered to be skilled to Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) level 3-5, other than “6135 Care workers and home carers”, which is considered to be skilled to RQF level 2. This table relates to points options F-J set out in Appendix Skilled Worker.

Except where option I or the Temporary Shortage List in SW 6.1A applies, sponsors may **ONLY**sponsor Skilled Worker applicants in these SOC2020 occupation codes if the applicant was granted permission as a Skilled Worker under the rules in place before 22 July 2025, and they have had continuous permission as a Skilled Worker since then.

These SOC 2020 occupation codes are not eligible for the Global Business Mobility or Scale-up routes.

Other than skill level, the notes accompanying Table 2 also apply to this table.

chunks.summary: This provision applies to Skilled Worker applicants granted permission before 22 July 2025 with specific SOC 2020 codes at RQF levels 3-5 (except care workers at level 2). It requires sponsors to sponsor only those with continuous permission under the pre-2025 rules, excluding routes like Global Business Mobility. Certain occupation codes are ineligible for other visa routes.

Document: Immigration Rules Appendix Skilled Occupations
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Skilled Occupations
Section ID: Table 2aa: Additional eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates for Skilled Worker applicants granted permission under the rules in place before 22 July 2025
Section: Table 2aa: Additional eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates for Skilled Worker applicants granted permission under the rules in place before 22 July 2025
Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to Skilled Worker applicants granted permission before 22 July 2025 with specific SOC 2020 codes at RQF levels 3-5 (except care workers at level 2). It requires sponsors to sponsor only those with continuous permission under the pre-2025 rules, excluding routes like Global Business Mobility. Certain occupation codes are ineligible for other visa routes.

### Table 2aa: Additional eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates for Skilled Worker applicants granted permission under the rules in place before 22 July 2025

These SOC 2020 occupation codes are considered to be skilled to Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) level 3-5, other than “6135 Care workers and home carers”, which is considered to be skilled to RQF level 2. This table relates to points options F-J set out in Appendix Skilled Worker.

Except where option I or the Temporary Shortage List in SW 6.1A applies, sponsors may **ONLY**sponsor Skilled Worker applicants in these SOC2020 occupation codes if the applicant was granted permission as a Skilled Worker under the rules in place before 22 July 2025, and they have had continuous permission as a Skilled Worker since then.

These SOC 2020 occupation codes are not eligible for the Global Business Mobility or Scale-up routes.

Other than skill level, the notes accompanying Table 2 also apply to this table.

metadata.section_title: Table 2a: Additional eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates for Skilled Worker applicants granted permission under the rules in place before 4 April 2024

chunks.text:
### Table 2a: Additional eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates for Skilled Worker applicants granted permission under the rules in place before 4 April 2024

These SOC 2020 occupation codes were previously considered to be skilled to Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) level 3-5, but have been reassessed as being below RQF level 3. This table relates to points options F-J set out in Appendix Skilled Worker.

Sponsors may **ONLY**sponsor Skilled Worker applicants in these SOC2020 occupation codes if the date of application is before 4 April 2030, the applicant was granted permission as a Skilled Worker under the rules in place before 4 April 2024, has had continuous permission as a Skilled Worker since then, and is applying to work for the same sponsor as in their most recent permission.

These SOC 2020 occupation codes are not eligible for the Global Business Mobility or Scale-up routes.

Other than skill level, the notes accompanying Table 2 also apply to this table.

| SOC 2020 occupation code | Equivalent SOC 2010 occupation code(s) | Examples of related job titles (non-exclusive) | Going rate (SW – option F) | 70% of going rate (SW – option J) | Eligible for PhD points (SW)? |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 3214 Complementary health associate professionals | 3219 | • Alexander technique teachers • Aromatherapists • Homeopaths (excludes medically qualified) • Hospital play specialists • Hypnotherapists • Massage therapists • Reflexologists • Reiki healers • Complementary health associate professionals not elsewhere classified | £31,300 (£16.05 per hour) | £25,000 (£12.82 per hour) | No |
| 6116 Nannies and au pairs | 6122 | • Au pairs • Nannies | £31,300 (£16.05 per hour) | £25,000 (£12.82 per hour) | No |
| 6232 Caretakers | 1251, 6144 | • Caretakers | £31,300 (£16.05 per hour) | £25,000 (£12.82 per hour) | No |
| 6250 Bed and breakfast and guest house owners and proprietors | 1221 | • Bed and breakfast and guest house owners and proprietors | £31,300 (£16.05 per hour) | £25,000 (£12.82 per hour) | No |
| 7115 Vehicle and parts salespersons and advisers | 3542 | • Vehicle parts advisers • Vehicle sales executives | £31,300 (£16.05 per hour) | £25,000 (£12.82 per hour) | No |
| 7125 Visual merchandisers and related occupations | 7125 | • Fashion stylists • Visual merchandisers and window dressers • Visual merchandisers and related occupations not elsewhere classified | £31,300 (£16.05 per hour) | £25,000 (£12.82 per hour) | No |
| 7129 Sales related occupations not elsewhere classified | 3542 | • Demonstrators and product promoters • Hire desk controllers • Sales energy consultants • Sales related occupations not elsewhere classified | £31,300 (£16.05 per hour) | £25,000 (£12.82 per hour) | No |
| 8115 Metal making and treating process operatives | 5234, 5449 | • Galvanisers and platers • Metal sprayers and powder coaters • Metal making and treating process operatives not elsewhere classified | £31,300 (£16.05 per hour) | £25,000 (£12.82 per hour) | No |
| 9252 Warehouse operatives | 4134 | • Warehouse operatives | £31,300 (£16.05 per hour) | £25,000 (£12.82 per hour) | No |
chunks.summary: This provision applies to Skilled Worker applicants under certain SOC 2020 codes below RQF level 3, sponsored before 4 April 2024. Applicants must have continuous permission since then and apply to work for the same sponsor; these codes exclude Global Business Mobility and Scale-up routes. Eligibility depends on meeting specified going rates and skill criteria outlined in the rules.

### Table 2b: Additional eligible SOC 2020 occupation codes and related going rates for Global Business Mobility applicants granted permission under the rules in place before 4 April 2024

These SOC 2020 occupation codes were previously considered to be skilled to Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) level 6 or above, but have been reassessed as being below RQF level 6.

Sponsors may **ONLY**sponsor Global Business Mobility applicants in these SOC 2020 occupation codes if the date of application is before 4 April 2030, the applicant was granted permission as a lead applicant on a Global Business Mobility route under the Rules in place before 4 April 2024, and they have had continuous permission as a lead applicant on the Global Business Mobility route since then.

Other than skill level, the notes accompanying Table 2 also apply to this table, except that equivalent SOC 2010 occupation codes are only included where they were previously eligible for the Global Business Mobility routes.

chunks.text:
### Table 3: Eligible health and education SOC 2020 occupation codes where going rates are based on national pay scales

These SOC 2020 occupation codes are considered to be skilled to Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) level 6 or above, and are eligible for the Skilled Worker, Global Business Mobility and Scale-up routes, other than roles below Agenda for Change band 5, which are ineligible for the Global Business Mobility and Scale-up routes, and are only eligible for the Skilled Worker route if the conditions specified in Table 4 are met.

SOC 2020 occupation codes in Table 3 are eligible for points option K set out in Appendix Skilled Worker. They are also eligible for the Global Business Mobility and Scale-up routes.

Equivalent SOC 2010 occupation codes are included where they were previously eligible for the Skilled Worker route, for ease of matching to the relevant SOC 2020 occupation codes for applicants being sponsored to continue working in the same occupation.

| SOC 2020 occupation code | Equivalent SOC 2010 occupation code(s) | Examples of related job titles (non-exclusive) | Going rate (annual) | National pay scale source |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |

They must be pro-rated for other working patterns, based on the weekly working hours stated by the applicant’s sponsor. | [Pay and Conditions Circular (M&D) 5/2024 R](https://www.nhsemployers.org/system/files/2024-09/Pay-and-Conditions-Circular-MD-5-2024-R.pdf) |

chunks.summary: This provision applies to health and education occupations with SOC 2020 codes at RQF level 6 or above, eligible for Skilled Worker, Global Business Mobility, and Scale-up routes. Document: Immigration Rules Appendix Skilled Occupations
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Skilled Occupations
Section ID: Table 3: Eligible health and education SOC 2020 occupation codes where going rates are based on national pay scales
Section: Table 3: Eligible health and education SOC 2020 occupation codes where going rates are based on national pay scales
Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to health and education occupations with SOC 2020 codes at RQF level 6 or above, eligible for Skilled Worker, Global Business Mobility, and Scale-up routes. It mandates that such roles, excluding certain Agenda for Change band 5 roles, meet specific going rate thresholds based on national pay scales. Exceptions apply for roles below specified pay bands or conditions outlined in subsequent tables.

### Table 3: Eligible health and education SOC 2020 occupation codes where going rates are based on national pay scales

These SOC 2020 occupation codes are considered to be skilled to Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) level 6 or above, and are eligible for the Skilled Worker, Global Business Mobility and Scale-up routes, other than roles below Agenda for Change band 5, which are ineligible for the Global Business Mobility and Scale-up routes, and are only eligible for the Skilled Worker route if the conditions specified in Table 4 are met.

SOC 2020 occupation codes in Table 3 are eligible for points option K set out in Appendix Skilled Worker. They are also eligible for the Global Business Mobility and Scale-up routes.

Equivalent SOC 2010 occupation codes are included where they were previously eligible for the Skilled Worker route, for ease of matching to the relevant SOC 2020 occupation codes for applicants being sponsored to continue working in the same occupation.
